CalvesSL45ReverseCalfPress.name: Sled 45째 Reverse Calf Press
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet very high on platform, grasp handles to sides, and extend knees.
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfPress.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfPress.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaise.name: Sled 45째 Reverse Calf Raise
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding. Grasp handles to sides and place feet on platform. Straighten knees and position heels on top edge of platform.
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up and back toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. Repeat.
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaise.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Also known as Sled Donkey Reverse Calf Raise. Also see movement performed on Sled Hack Press. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaisePL.name: Sled 45째 Reverse Calf Raise (plate loaded)
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaisePL.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding. Grasp handles to sides and place feet on platform. Straighten knees and position heels on top edge of platform.
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaisePL.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up and back toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. Repeat.
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaisePL.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Also known as Sled Donkey Reverse Calf Raise. Also see movement performed on Sled Hack Press. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaiseHackPress.name: Sled 45째 Reverse Calf Raise (on hack press)
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaiseHackPress.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding. Grasp handles to sides and place feet on top portion of platform. Straighten knees and position heels on top edge of platform.
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaiseHackPress.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up and back toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet return to platform. Repeat.
CalvesSL45ReverseCalfRaiseHackPress.comments: Feet should be place highest position that still allows forefeet to make contact with platform. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Exercise is performed on apparatus design to perform Hack Press. Also see similar movement performed on Sled Donkey Calf Machine. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSLDonkeyReverseCalfRaise.name: Sled Reverse Donkey Calf Raise (plate loaded)
CalvesSLDonkeyReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Position lower back and hips under upper pad. Place forearms on supports. Position heels on forward edge of platform.
CalvesSLDonkeyReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot up and toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. Repeat.
CalvesSLDonkeyReverseCalfRaise.comments: Often bending at the hip typically reduces range of motion at ankle during dorsal flexion. Two remedies include (1) end knees slightly, (2) position torso more upright supported by extended arms, effectively reducing bend at hip as shown with Lever Reverse Donkey Calf Raise. In this last case, Triceps Brachii would act as stabilizer. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSLHackReverseCalfRaise.name: Sled Hack Reverse Calf Raise
CalvesSLHackReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Lie supine on back pad with shoulders against pads. Place feet very high on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock levers.
CalvesSLHackReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. Repeat.
CalvesSLHackReverseCalfRaise.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Dock levers may not need to be released depending on machine model and body height. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSLLyingReverseCalfPress.name: Sled Lying Reverse Calf Press
CalvesSLLyingReverseCalfPress.preparation: Position sled away from platform. Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet very high on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
CalvesSLLyingReverseCalfPress.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
CalvesSLLyingReverseCalfPress.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSLLyingReverseCalfPressPL.name: Sled Lying Reverse Calf Press (plate loaded)
CalvesSLLyingReverseCalfPressPL.preparation: Position sled away from platform. Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet very high on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
CalvesSLLyingReverseCalfPressPL.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
CalvesSLLyingReverseCalfPressPL.comments: If sled bottoms out on dock lever, disengage it to allow full range of motion. Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSLReverseCalfRaise.name: Sled Standing Reverse Calf Raise
CalvesSLReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded bars. Stand erect by extending hips and knees. Position heels on forward edge of platform positioned under padded bars. Grasp ends or sides of padded bars.
CalvesSLReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
CalvesSLReverseCalfRaise.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSLReverseCalfRaisePL.name: Sled Reverse Calf Raise (plate loaded)
CalvesSLReverseCalfRaisePL.preparation: Place shoulders under padded bars. Stand erect by extending hips and knees. Position heels on forward edge of platform positioned under padded bars. Grasp handles or sides of padded bars.
CalvesSLReverseCalfRaisePL.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
CalvesSLReverseCalfRaisePL.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesSLSeatedReverseCalfPress.name: Sled Seated Reverse Calf Press
CalvesSLSeatedReverseCalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat and place feet very high on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend knees.
CalvesSLSeatedReverseCalfPress.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
CalvesSLSeatedReverseCalfPress.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.
